course.subject: SBMT
course.name: Business Competitions
course.description: In each business competition, students will be required to examine the conceptual and practical aspects of business policies and policy decision making by utilizing all the concepts, theories and tools that they learned in previous courses.  This 1-credit course is offered in recognition of the students' outstanding performance in their participation of business competitions. Approval from the course coordinator is needed prior to enrolling in the course.  Graded P or F.

reviews.author: Alvin Chai
reviews.title: Business Competitions
reviews.comment_content: There is a list of competitions you can check whether you are eligible to apply.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not a regular course at HKUST, you just need to win the case competition stated in the list.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass/fail (1 credit), you will get the credit as long as you met the requirement as it is only a one credit course.
reviews.comment_workload: Just have to submit a report attach with photos as evidence. Basically the report is all about your past reflection and describe your experience. It took around 2 weeks for the SBM office to approve my application.

reviews.author: Cçš®
reviews.comment_content:
Easy to apply.
Eligibility: Winning awards in case competitions
reviews.comment_teaching: The staff are patient and willing to help when you face any difficulty while applying.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or fail.
Pass as long as all requirements are fulfilled. They will approach you and offer you help if you omit to submit something.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just a few files and forms to submit.
Briefly write about your experiences and learnings.
Remember to take some pictures during your final round because you will have to hand them in. Our group only handed in one photo taken after the competition but they still accepted our application.
